channel.title: Compile error =\
channel.description:
hey.. so yeah i don't normally have to deal with these kind of problems, but once again.. my brother wants to play a server with a friend but he can't get the compiler to work. I have not seen an error like this in a couple years and can't really remember how to fix it :eek: but anyways heres the compiler code: [code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
and then this is what happens when you compile...
[code]You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
And it opens up IE explorer (ew) and brings you to the java page. we obviously have java installed but.. don't really know what to do :( help would be appreciated!

item.title: Compile error =\
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Go to:

C:/Program Files/Java/

and post what version you have.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error =\
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

@echo off
if exist "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java" (call :compile "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it from the Java website..
::"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Try that, you should post what OS you are using in the OP.

[hr]

If all else fails and all classes are in the same directory, just use this.
(Assuming you have your environment variables set)

@echo off
javac *.java
echo Files Compiled Successfully.
pause
goto end
:end
echo Hope I could help!
pause
exit

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error =\
item.dc:creator: @bob_tomato12 bob tomato12
item.description:
@bob_tomato12 wrote:

well it is a 317, but that didn’t seem to work… this is somewhat of an oldschool source so… any other suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error =\
item.dc:creator: @gray561 gray561
item.description:
@gray561 wrote:

What kind of source are you using? If it a 317 here’s one for ya, its pretty basic just change the 1.7.0 to your version of java
[@echo off
cd scr
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause ]

Read full topic
